content.question: Assume the economy is initially in long-run equilibrium. Which of the following describes how the short-run effect of an increase in personal income taxes would be depicted in the Phillips curve model provided?

choices.label: A movement along <math alttext="S R P C sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>SRPC</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math> from point A to point B
A movement along <math alttext="S R P C sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>SRPC</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> from point C to point D
A movement along LRPC from point C to point E

A shift from <math alttext="S R P C sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>SRPC</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> to <math alttext="S R P C sub 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>SRPC</mtext><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

A shift from <math alttext="S R P C sub 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>SRPC</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> to <math alttext="S R P C sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>SRPC</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: A movement along <math alttext="S R P C sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>SRPC</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math> from point A to point B
